title: Capacity-Building Program for Mathematics Instructional Designers Based on Reflective Learning Communities

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Process for pre-service/in-service teachers to develop mathematics instructional design capabilities through reflective learning communities. Ensures accessibility via smartphone-based microlearning, reinforces practical skills through project-based assessment

learning_goals: Learners can improve instructional design plans by completing at least four peer feedback cycles through reflective learning community activities.
Learners can apply three instructional design frameworks tailored to the characteristics of mathematics subjects to real-world cases.
Learners can participate in and contribute to weekly microlearning activities at least 80% of the time to collaboratively construct knowledge in a mobile environment.

resources: Template Library for Mathematics Instructional Design
Digital Tool for Reflective Journal Writing
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
